title: The Un-Optimized List | Anton Ebsen
description: A tribute to the slow, the analog, and the intentionally inefficient.

hero.title: The Un-Optimized List
hero.text: In a world of biohacking, deep work, and constant optimization, here are the things I do that are intentionally inefficient. Because joy cannot always be measured in a spreadsheet.

items.title: Fountain Pen & Paper
items.desc: Writing by hand with a Lamy pen. It takes longer than typing, but thoughts flow differently.

items.title: Film Photography
items.desc: Waiting for the film to be developed. No previews, no instant gratification – just the process.

items.title: Coffee as a Craft
items.desc: A manual pour-over that takes 10 minutes to prepare. It's inefficient caffeine intake, but a fantastic meditation.

items.title: Gadget-Free Walks
items.desc: No podcasts, no step counter, no phone. Just my own thoughts and the sound of my shoes against the pavement.

philosophy.title: Why This Matters
philosophy.text: Optimization is a tool, not a goal in itself. By consciously choosing inefficient processes, I remind myself that I control the technology – and not the other way around.
